snippet: In the face of the public’s weakened confidence in Albuquerque’s police after a string of shootings and clashes with protesters, officials called for calm.
abstract: New Mexico Gov Susana Martinez and Albuquerque city officials are urging calm as protests over string of fatal police shootings intensify; shootings of homeless man James Boyd last month and other people who most likely had mental illnesses raise questions about whether inadequate training may have played a role and highlight increasing use by police of military-style weapons to fight street crime.

byline.contributor: Trip Jennings contributed reporting from Albuquerque, and Timothy Williams from New York.

lead_paragraph: In the face of the public’s weakened confidence in Albuquerque’s police after a string of shootings and clashes with protesters, officials called for calm.

headline.main: Officials Urge Calm as Protests Take a Turn in Albuquerque
headline.print_headline: Officials Urge Calm as Protests Take a Turn
